questions.latexText: \(A force    ˆˆ ˆ F 2i bj k is applied on a particle and it undergoes a displacement  ˆˆ ˆ i 2j – k . What will be the value of b, if work done on the particle is zero. (1) 0 (2) 1^{2} (3) 1^{3} (4) 2\)

questions.text: Given below are two statements. On is labelled as Assertion (A) and the other is labelled as Reason (R). Assertion (A) : In Young’s double slit experiment, the fringes produced by red light are closer as compared to those produced by blue light. Reason (R) : The fringe width is directly proportional to the wavelength of light. In the light of above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below : (1) Both (A) and (R) are true and (R) is the correct

questions.text: Given are statements for certain thermodynamic variables, (A) Internal energy, volume (V) and mass (M) are extensive variables. (B) Pressure (P), temperature (T) and density () are intensive variables. (C) Volume (V), temperature (T) and density () are intensive variables. (D) Mass (M), temperature (T) and internal energy are extensive variables. Choose the correct answer from the points given below : (1) (C) and (D) only (2) (D) and (A) only (3) (A) and (B) only (4) (B) and (C) only

5 ms

–27 kg.

When the electric field is switched off, the proton moves along a circular path of radius 2 cm. The magnitude of electric field is x \times 10^{4} \frac{N}{C}. the value of x is _____. Take the mass of the proton = 1.6 \times 10 –27 kg.\)

questions.text:
A tube of length 1m is filled completely with an ideal liquid of mass 2M, and closed at both ends. The tube is rotated uniformly in horizontal plane about one of its ends. If the force exerted by the liquid at the other end is F then angular velocity of the tube is 
F
M in SI unit. The value of  is ______.
